results.title: The Other Thailand
results.creator_credit: Alan Bateman, Geoffrey Barnes and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Journey into Thailand”.
This program, presented by Keith Adam, describes the southern area of Thailand where the majority of the people are Muslim. It explores the industries in the area and the conflicts with the northern Buddhist population.

results.title: The Other side of the coin = Il Rovescio della medaglia
results.brief_description: Documentary film about post World War II Italian migrants living in somewhat depressed circumstances in Sydney. A group of Italian men discuss their situations since arriving in Australia, the discrimination, their inability to obtain a decent paying job no matter how skilled they are, their inadequate living conditions and lack of money and education, and the threat of deportation if their political beliefs (particularly those of socialist/communist persuasion) are too radical in the minds of the incumbent Liberal government (1978) whose politics of assimilation appear to be the driving force. Loneliness and alienation are part of daily existence amongst the migrant community, more so with the older generation as their children having been taught English at school, refuse to speak Italian at home. There appears to be a sense of a loss of culture and language contrary to the perception that post-war Australia is made up of a multilingual and multicultural society. The background story to the film which provides the basis for discussion about migrant rights is the deportation in 1978 of a radical community worker, Ignazio Salemi. Includes archival footage of Italian labourers working the Queensland cane fields during the 1950s.

results.title: The Other olympians
results.creator_credit: Ian Lang, Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School and Andrew Wiseman
results.brief_description: A documentary which examines the training procedures of two paraplegic athletes preparing for the Olympics for the Disabled staged in the Netherlands in 1980. Also covers the rehabilitation period of a young man who has only recently been left paralysed as the result of an accident. Narrated by Phillip Adams.

results.title: The Other fellow's feeling
results.brief_description: Deals with a typical problem of young adolescents; teasing or ridicule which can be prolonged to the point of being damaging. The film considers the case of a girl student whose life is made miserable from the teasing by boys in her class. Teacher and students discuss the problem and suggest ways of overcoming teasing. The film deliberately omits providing a solution to the problem; the aim of the film is to stimulate students in arriving at their own conclusions.

results.title: The Other Face of the Ira
results.brief_description: An item from the American television program, “Sixty Minutes”, made at the time of the hunger strikes in H-block of Maze prison, attempting to analyse, through interviews, the political motivations and beliefs of the Provisional IRA

results.title: The Other days of Ruby Rae
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television, Australian Film Commission and Vikki Blanche
results.brief_description: A country town priest (Norman Kaye) becomes increasingly unreliable and approachable after a protracted period of mourning following the death of his wife 10 years before. Ruby Rae, a 10 year old girl enters suddenly into his life and the two establish a warm friendship. Through a series of shared (but simple experiences) made delightful with Ruby’s observations along the way, Reverend Walsh’s faith is restored. Cast includes Margaret Mills and Aletha McGrath. Music by Brett Rosenberg.

results.title: The Other city
results.creator_credit: John F. Becker and American Cancer Society
results.brief_description: Uses Racine, Wisconsin, USA to symbolically depict the tragedy of the 75,000 who die needlessly of cancer each year. Shows how Racine becomes a silent city without life. Illustrates the contrast between a cycle of orderly growth and nature unruly and without order. Emphasises the cases of seven people to portray the seven danger signals of cancer.

results.title: The Oriole Hall
results.creator_credit: China Film Corporation and Chen Jinti
results.brief_description: Within the walls of the Summer Palace, there is a beautiful courtyard named Oriole Hall. This is where the Empress Dowager used to enjoy music and opera. People thought the music was so sweet that it must be the singing of orioles. Now this old courtyard has become a restaurant where tourists can enjoy special dishes prepared in the style of former imperial kitchens.

results.title: The Origins of weather
results.creator_credit: Tom Daly, ONF | NFB and Joseph Koenig
results.brief_description: Illustrates, from the vantage of off-the-Earth observation, the factors that produce the climate we know. Animation shows the Earth’s dynamic heat exchange—the effect of the sun’s heat, the movement of air masses. Resulting weather is then shown.
